name: TheAtlantic
text: "I don’t want to treat our fellow citizens with open contempt, or to confront and berate them. Rather, I am arguing for silence," @RadioFreeTom writes: https://t.co/PMwRGkZIut

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Narendra Modi’s government has a track record for dismissing those who protest against its policies as being "anti-national."

I wrote about why this strategy is failing against the farmers' protest:
https://t.co/fWSnk64SGV

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week's "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who is struggling to get through the holiday season after her parents' divorce several years ago. https://t.co/kqDDz2BXO2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Zoom will not make public transit obsolete, @JSadikKhan and @SethSolomonow predict. "In post-pandemic America," they write, "restoring transit will be as essential as restoring power lines, water mains, and roads after a natural or economic disaster." https://t.co/qZaoNH1i5t

name: TheAtlantic
text: Few state leaders in America have more power over their police forces than the attorney general of New Jersey. He's deploying that power today, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/hg9UshFJFV

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: "With the farmers prepared to protest for as long as it takes, there is no easy way out. For Modi, there is no nationalist fix this time."

@YasmeenSerhan's latest in @TheAtlantic https://t.co/fHZkdkMcMC

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Alaska: Images of the Last Frontier - the 50th in a year-long photo series, focusing on each of the 50 states in the United States of America. https://t.co/95GscRSns9 https://t.co/Uefdaf7lPU

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: My piece this AM: New Jersey is today embarking on what is likely the nation's most ambitious police reform—an overhaul of its use-of-force policy, a new reporting portal, and a retraining of all 38,000 officers in the state: https://t.co/kuxEZI6LQ7

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: “This policy is an acknowledgment that we’re living in different times,” he said. “It’s essentially saying, We expect better of our police departments than merely what the law allows.” https://t.co/UsBHDWr5cg via @russellberman

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: A self-directed architectural tour of Chicago can reveal surprising stories of transition and resilience from the Windy City's storied past: https://t.co/qYdtUrIkbf @Toyota https://t.co/iauiOZmOlI

name: TheAtlantic
text: Protests by farmers are testing the limits of Narendra Modi's nationalism, writes @YasmeenSerhan: https://t.co/Ni0VzCZTn0

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: @BlackRock identifies 3 areas U.S. consumers are still spending, and why they've stayed resilient through the pandemic: https://t.co/QTTVVR8ApS https://t.co/GIHNANgFGQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: It might be tempting to try to draw meaning from a rare cosmic conjunction—but first, go outside tonight and see Jupiter and Saturn, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/PLzgjcq8cE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some evidence has suggested that taking melatonin could help slow COVID-19. But the real key may be sleep itself, @jameshamblin reports: https://t.co/j7RSIaNVub

name: TheAtlantic
text: Today is #NationalCrosswordPuzzleDay. Earlier this year, we expanded our puzzles to the weekend and launched a new feature that allows you to play with friends. If you’re inspired to join our crossword-puzzle community, here are some tips for beginners: https://t.co/yi1R6FJ8fa
